title: Trump Heads to Davos Amid Deep Worries About U.S.-European Alliance
summary: The gathering of the global elite is set to serve as an all-hands effort to de-escalate tensions between President Trump and America’s allies over his insistence on acquiring Greenland.

title: Air Force One Turns Back With Trump After Electrical Issue
summary: The plane was heading for Switzerland when it turned back for Joint Base Andrews. A White House official said there had been a minor electrical issue.

title: Some Republicans Begin to Echo Trump’s Case to Acquire Greenland
summary: While the party remains split as President Trump presses to “take” Greenland, some in his party are publicly embracing his reasoning for wanting to control the territory.

title: Carney Speech on U.S. ‘Rupture’ and Canada’s Survival Draws Standing Ovation at Davos
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney got a standing ovation in Davos for starkly describing the end of Pax Americana. He is looking for new allies to help his country survive it.

title: Carney’s World Economic Forum Speech Warns of Global Breakdown
summary: As President Trump continued his quest for Greenland, Prime Minister Mark Carney said great powers were unrestrained and urged medium-size countries to band together.

title: ‘God Is Very Proud’: Trump Marks Anniversary With a Victory Lap
summary: For roughly one hour 45 minutes, President Trump meandered through his accomplishments and grievances, attacked perceived enemies and threatened allies.

title: Halligan Leaves as U.S. Attorney After Mounting Pressure From Judges
summary: For weeks, judges have pressed Ms. Halligan to explain why she continues to identify herself in court filings as the U.S. attorney, despite a ruling in November that she was unlawfully appointed to the job.

title: ChongLy Scott Thao, Hmong Immigrant and U.S. Citizen, Arrested by ICE
summary: A Hmong immigrant, who is a U.S. citizen, was released after being questioned for an hour. Federal officials said they had been seeking sex offenders.

title: Cuban Immigrant Was Killed in ICE Custody, Family Says in Legal Filing
summary: The family of Geraldo Lunas Campos said a witness saw him choked by guards in an El Paso detention facility this month. Federal officials said he died by suicide.

title: Trump Calls Renee Good Killing a ‘Tragedy’ and Says ICE Agents Will Make Mistakes
summary: The change in tone was stark for the president, who said he had been told that Ms. Good’s father was a strong Trump supporter.

title: In Court Record, Official Describes Assault Before ICE Agent Shot Man in Minneapolis
summary: The agent told an investigator that he was assaulted with a broom and a shovel before he fired a single shot that wounded a Venezuelan man.

title: C.I.A.’s New Focus on Latin America Reflected in Raid to Seize Maduro
summary: A senior U.S. official declined to confirm the specific operations in Venezuela, but said a covert team provided real-time support for the military.

title: House Foreign Affairs Members Call for Machado to Govern Venezuela
summary: The Venezuelan opposition leader stressed the need for free elections in her latest bipartisan meeting with lawmakers.

title: Taiwan’s $40 Billion Military Spending Plan Stalled by Political Impasse
summary: Taiwan’s domestic gridlock is revealing a deep-seated fracture over how the island should defend itself and how much it can depend on the United States.

title: California Republicans Ask Supreme Court to Block New Congressional Map
summary: Republicans asked the justices to step in after a federal court rejected their claims that the state’s new congressional map violated the Constitution.

title: Scientists Set Up Camp on Thwaites Glacier in Antarctica
summary: Low clouds have lifted long enough for helicopters to ferry scientists and their gear to a fast-melting glacier on the edge of Antarctica.

title: Man Gets Life in Prison for Killing Shinzo Abe, Former Leader of Japan
summary: Tetsuya Yamagami, 45, had admitted to shooting Mr. Abe, Japan’s longest-serving prime minister, with a homemade gun at a political rally in 2022.

title: Despite Drastic Financial Steps, Met Opera Turns to Layoffs and Cuts
summary: The largest performing arts organization in the country will lay off workers, cut salaries and reduce its offerings. It may also sell its Chagall murals that are valued at $55 million.

title: Photographer Discovers Train Part That Could Hold Key to Spain Train Crash
summary: Officials said they had located a previously unreported train undercarriage near the site of a deadly train crash in Spain. Experts said the finding could help investigators.

title: Another Train Crash in Spain Kills 1 and Hurts 37, Officials Say
summary: Train service in the Catalonia region will be suspended until it is safe to resume rail traffic, the local operator said.

title: What to Know About Brooklyn Beckham’s Accusations Against His Parents
summary: On Monday, the eldest Beckham son posted one-sided explosive accusations against his parents on Instagram. His parents have not responded directly.

title: Trump’s Politics Are Not America First. They’re Me First.
summary: Donald Trump is the most un-American president in our history. And in his second term, there is no one to constrain his un-American impulses.

title: Europe Has a Bazooka. Time to Use It.
summary: For now, Europe’s anti-coercion instrument is less a bazooka than a waterlogged firecracker.

title: Forecasters Warn of a Major Storm Brewing for the South
summary: One meteorologist warns that “the main ingredients” are fitting into place for a disruptive winter storm later this week.

title: Valentino Defined the Way ‘Rich’ Once Looked
summary: The death of the designer Valentino marks the end of an era, not just in fashion but in dressing the part.

title: Georges Borchardt, 97, Dies; Literary Agent Championed Wiesel’s ‘Night’
summary: Renowned in his field, he counted among his clients five Nobel laureates, including Elie Wiesel, and eight Pulitzer winners as well as the estates of Tennessee Williams and Aldous Huxley.

title: Mississippi Temple Says There Is More to Its Story Than Facing Hate
summary: An arson attack at a synagogue in Mississippi was a reminder of the threat Jews face, but also of the strength of a small community forged over generations.
